data.title: Board of Directors â€º High Plains Bank
data.text:
Sam is a Colorado native and he completed his undergraduate degree in Durango. For almost 25 years, Sam worked at the Texas-based Bohannon Development Corporation, a company that designed, built and managed large apartment complexes. In 2019, Sam and his wife Danye moved to Longmont so he could join the HPB team as Chief Administrative Officer. Sam is currently the Chairman and President of the High Plains Bank.

Sam enjoys running, cycling and looks forward to getting back into skiing and trying snow shoeing.

Jocelyn Gilligan grew up in Boulder, Colorado. After graduating with a B.S. in Finance from the University of Colorado, she commenced her career at Ernst & Young in New York City, later expanding her expertise in Shanghai and Hong Kong. During this time, she earned the CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) charter and eventually the CIPM (Certificate in Investment Performance Measurement) designation. Following her time abroad, Jocelyn relocated to Longmont, Colorado, with her husband where they co-founded a successful consulting business that aids investment firms in complying with the Global Investment Performance Standards, a framework for calculating and presenting investment performance according to a set of transparent and ethical principles. She and her team have worked with hundreds of investment firms around the world to help them comply with these global standards.

Beyond her entrepreneurial endeavors, she is a member of the Board of Education for the St. Vrain Valley School District and serves as Treasurer. Jocelyn also serves as an executive board member of the Central Elementary PTO. Currently, she and her husband are raising their four children in Longmont, Colorado where they enjoy a very active lifestyle in the Colorado outdoors.
